markdown.headingText: custom packages not loaded by helpers.R
markdown.markdown:
```{r set knitr options, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache = TRUE, include=FALSE) ``` ```{r set chart parameters} chart_details <- list( id = "police-arrests", title = "Police are arresting half as many people as a decade ago", subtitle = "A combination of legal changes and decreases in many common types of crime, together with closures of custody suites due to budget cuts, mean police are making about 760,000 fewer arrests per year now, compared to a decade ago. The number of children arrested has decreased fastest, potentially driven by recognition of the negative consequences of criminalising young people.", source_url = "https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/police-powers-and-procedures-england-and-wales-year-ending-31-march-2018", source_title = "Home Office, 2018" ) ``` ```{r load packages and helper} library("lubridate") library("reticulate") # load this after loading custom packages source(here::here("helpers.R")) ``` ```{r get and tidy data} if (!file.exists(paste0(chart_details$id, "-data.csv.gz"))) { # download most-recent data new_data_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".ods") new_csv_file <- paste0(new_data_file, ".csv") GET("https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/751158/arrests-open-data-tables-ppp.ods", write_disk(new_data_file)) # convert new data from ODS to CSV and read source_python(here::here("ods_to_csv.py")) ods_to_csv(new_data_file, "AOD_0607_1718", new_csv_file) file_data <- read_csv(new_csv_file, na = c("..", "*", "N/A")) # tidy data tidy_data <- file_data %>% clean_names() %>% # for some reason there are empty rows at the end of the file filter(financial_year != "") %>% rename( offence_group = reason_for_arrest_offence_group, ethnic_group = ethnic_group_self_defined ) %>% mutate(year_ending = ymd(paste(str_sub(financial_year, -2), "03", "31"))) # save tidy data write_csv(tidy_data, paste0(chart_details$id, "-data.csv.gz")) } else { # load tidy data tidy_data <- read_csv(paste0(chart_details$id, "-data.csv.gz")) } officer_data <- here::here("post/police-numbers/police-numbers-data.csv.gz") %>% read_csv() %>% mutate(year_ending = ymd(paste(year, "03", "31"))) %>% count(year_ending, wt = officers, name = "officers") ``` ```{r prepare data for chart} chart_data <- tidy_data %>% filter( age_group %in% c("10 - 17 years", "18 - 20 years", "21 years and over"), year_ending >= ymd("2009-03-31") ) %>% count(year_ending, sex, age_group, wt = arrests, name = "arrests") %>% left_join(officer_data) %>% group_by(sex, age_group) %>% mutate( arrest_rate = (arrests / officers), arrest_index = (arrest_rate / first(arrest_rate)) * 100 ) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(group = fct_case_when( sex == "Female" & age_group == "10 - 17 years" ~ "girls\n10–17 years", sex == "Male" & age_group == "10 - 17 years" ~ "boys\n10–17 years", sex == "Female" & age_group == "18 - 20 years" ~ "women\n18–20 years", sex == "Male" & age_group == "18 - 20 years" ~ "men\n18–20 years", sex == "Female" & age_group == "21 years and over" ~ "women\n21+ years", sex == "Male" & age_group == "21 years and over" ~ "men\n21+ years", TRUE ~ NA_character_ )) chart_labels <- chart_data %>% group_by(group) %>% summarise( year_ending = last(year_ending), arrest_index = last(arrest_index), label = sprintf("down **%.0f%%**
in 10 years
to %s", 100 - last(arrest_index), scales::comma(last(arrests))) ) ``` ```{r build plot} chart <- ggplot(chart_data, aes(year_ending, arrest_index, fill = group)) + geom_area() + ggtext::geom_richtext(aes(label = label), data = chart_labels, colour = "white", size = elements$label_text_size, hjust = 1, vjust = 1, label.size = NA) + # geom_point(data = chart_labels) + scale_x_date(date_breaks = "2 years", date_labels = "'%y", expand = expand_scale(mult = c(0, 0.05))) + scale_y_continuous(expand = expand_scale(mult = c(0, 0.05))) + scale_fill_manual( values = unname(ucl_colours_list[c("Mid Green", "Bright Green", "Mid Red", "Light Red", "Mid Blue", "Light Blue")]) ) + facet_grid(cols = vars(group)) + labs( title = chart_details$title, subtitle = format_subtitle(chart_details$subtitle), legend = NULL, x = NULL, y = "arrests for every 100 arrests per officer in 2008–09" ) + theme_cjcharts() + theme( axis.title = element_text(hjust = 0), legend.position = "none" ) ``` `r chart_details$subtitle` ```{r display plot, echo=FALSE, include=TRUE} add_logo(chart + labs(title = NULL, subtitle = NULL), chart_details$source_title, chart_details$id) ``` [larger image](../`r chart_details$id`.png) | [annotated R code to produce this chart](https://github.com/mpjashby/cj-charts/blob/master/content/`r chart_details$id`.Rmd) Data source: [`r chart_details$source_title`](`r chart_details$source_url`) ```{r export chart} # save PNG for social media ggsave( filename = paste0(chart_details$id, ".png"), plot = add_logo(chart, chart_details$source_title, chart_details$id), device = "png", width = 600 / 72, height = 400 / 72, units = "in" ) ```
